alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 4:18AM EST until December 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 7 AM EST Monday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from midnight tonight to 8 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Minor inundation of NC 12 possible on Pea Island. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will rise very rapidly as a very strong cold front crosses the sounds before dawn Monday morning, with water levels on the sound side potentially increasing by up to 3 ft within an hour.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
